column1: New York's COVID-19 regulations should be consistent and based on common sense. Shutting down gyms at 10pm will cause even more crowding during the other hours of the day. If this decision has any impact on COVID-19 spread then it's a negative one. https://t.co/kEWstvPVe3
More big COVID-19 vaccine news this morning! https://t.co/54CWctuaZT

Amy Thomas is Asst Chief of South Country Ambulance in Brookhaven. During the height of the COVID-19 outbreak I worked around the clock to deliver vital PPE testing approvals funding & many other resources for our front line first responders law enforcement doctors & nurses. https://t.co/zkCjbdL45J

🚨Just released our new TV "It's Personal". Amy Thomas Asst Chief of South County Ambulance talks about the many ways I was delivering for our front line medical workers from the first moment the coronavirus pandemic reached Long Island earlier this year. Check it out here: https://t.co/c24OTKBxS7
There was NOTHING "open" "transparent" or "responsible" about the Chinese Communist Party's handling of the Coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/5YXVA2STlT

Just released this AM my 2nd TV ad of the 2020 campaign "Ready to Serve" discussing my work to help Long Island through a difficult time when the coronavirus outbreak hit us hard. https://t.co/9uH6F16SHT

Great news out of Suffolk County - we just had our 1st week w/ NO coronavirus deaths!  From PPE to testing CARES Act $ vents small biz $ & more there’s been key fed govt help all along the way.  There’s more work to do but this is an awesome update we just got regardless!

We can't discount the need for preventative medicine. It's important to focus on other health concerns that have fallen by the wayside due to COVID. Mental health matters. So do mammograms & the dentist & ophthalmologist. It's time to start reopening. https://t.co/sISQwrrW3R

LI has been hit hard by COVID-19. We couldn't possibly be more motivated to finish this fight. Finally we're seeing the light at the end of the tunnel. We must work towards opening LI ASAP in a safe manner that prevents another outbreak & protects our livelihoods & lives.

The House Foreign Affairs Committee should be investigating China & the origins of coronavirus. I explained why last night w/ @marklevinshow on "Life Liberty and Levin". It's a new week and yet another week the House of Representatives is AWOL out of DC. https://t.co/Z8y9XH5hHW

Frontline workers are selflessly doing their jobs. Congress needs to do its job as well. Great 3+ hr meeting w/@RealDonaldTrump yesterday @WhiteHouse to discuss #COVID19. Our frontline workers keep showing up to exceptionally perform. Congress owes it to them to get back to work.

Americans are more grateful than ever for our nurses. They have always put others first healing the sick & protecting public health long before COVID-19 ever emerged but this year especially they should be most appreciated beyond words. #NursesWeek https://t.co/GffJsIRDGo

While members of the House of Reps are spread out across the US under the Speaker's equivalent of a political shelter at home order front line workers in NYC are riding subways to work that have been coronavirus petri dishes. This is how Congress' low approval #s find new lows.

Smithtown resident Anne Giardin is 99-years-old and she crushed #COVID19! Congratulations to Anne and her family and thank you to the great healthcare professionals at The Hamlet Facility in Nesconset who took amazing care of her. https://t.co/jXpjlP1Xj5

Love it! Our heroes in the @NYPDnews joined by Smithtown deli owner Donato Panico honored our local healthcare workers on the front line battling COVID-19 with 700 sandwiches. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/lpcAoTRc8s

There are multiple overlapping fronts in the battle against coronavirus including health & economic. Tomorrow the House will vote on a bill prioritizing the recovery of both: $370B for small business via the PPP & EIDL $75B for hospitals for COVID-19 costs & $25B for testing.

Great meeting w @realDonaldTrump today at the White House to discuss continued #COVID19 response efforts. Meanwhile the Senate passed a bill today to fund PPP & EIDL for our small businesses. It also included hospital & testing funds. We will get through this together.

More good news in the battle against #COVID19. In NY total hospitalizations ICU admissions intubations and the death and infection rates are all down again. This is a product of all of us working together to stop the spread.   Big THANK YOU to our 1.1M healthcare warriors!

TY @UpstateNews for sending another group of 22 healthcare professionals to @stonybrooku. It is because of our nurses doctors respiratory technicians pharmacists & more that we are able to confront COVID-19 head on. LI will not forget this act of kindness. One team one fight! https://t.co/3j8WcTH1TB

Wishing all celebrating today #HappyEaster! To everyone leaving their family at home today to go back to the front lines of this battle against coronavirus THANK YOU for everything you are doing exceptionally well to care for others. We are all in this together as one community.

My fellow New Yorkers & I want to thank the @USNavy sailors aboard the #USNSComfort coming to help us combat the coronavirus outbreak. You are the best of who we are as Americans! 🇺🇸 https://t.co/7TGjFvCyRa

UPDATE: 200+ @USArmy soldiers w/the 531st Hospital Center are deploying to NY from Ft Campbell KY to assist in the COVID-19 fight. Grateful for these selfless men & women as well as all our medical pros first responders & law enforcement putting themselves on the line 🇺🇸

Was contacted earlier today by @SoftBank w/ an incredibly generous offer to purchase & donate 1.4 MIL n95 masks "to those on the front lines testing preventing and treating the spread of the COVID19 virus in New York." The first 500k masks will arrive in NY this Friday!

Following calls I made as well as others in Congress the IRS has moved its filing deadline 90 days from April 15 to July 15 in order to help families and businesses struggling from the impacts of the Coronavirus outbreak. I hope all states follow suit. https://t.co/rJ7ZeIrC5W

The @SBAgov just issued an emergency declaration to allow loans for small businesses in Suffolk. Each small business is eligible to receive up to $2 mil in assistance. Critical step in supporting our small businesses on LI that are struggling due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Last night Pres Trump signed the Families First Coronavirus Response Act. In this fresh bipartisan spirit for the greater good there's even more that can & must be done. We must do everything in our power to keep coronavirus from breaking our health our economy or our spirit.

The federal government has dispatched the USNS Comfort to NYC Harbor to help w treatment capacity. I want to commend @realDonaldTrump and @NYGovCuomo putting differences aside and working together to combat #coronavirus. #inittogether https://t.co/TXtAyIsa2c

Just visited the new free drive-thru coronavirus testing location now open in Suffolk at @StonyBrooku in the South Parking Lot. Before visiting call 1-888-364-3065 to schedule an appointment. To the medical professionals conducting tests & screenings thank you for all you do! https://t.co/6k9h3MliBb

Dr Fauci is absolutely right.   While it’s true coronavirus is most dangerous to seniors young people can still carry it and cause serious harm to their loved ones who are more vulnerable.   It is going to take ALL of us to make sacrifices to beat #COVID19. https://t.co/992ahcWQHo

Declaring a National Emergency is the right call.  This is not the time for half measures.  It will take everyone's full force to effectively respond to coronavirus.  Together we will emerge from this stronger than ever. #Covid_19

Cancelling St. Patrick's Day parades enacting travel restrictions and closing certain schools may seem like dramatic actions but due to the coronavirus these types of precautions are necessary for mitigation and prevention to keep people safe.

Bold but necessary decision by President Trump to suspend travel to Europe for the next 30 days in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. COVID-19 is a unique threat that will require many proactive measures from all levels of our government.

We should all take a moment to thank the incredible men & women of the @NationalGuardNY who will be delivering food to those quarantined with coronavirus & assisting with the cleanup of public areas in New Rochelle. They are the best of the best. 🇺🇸     https://t.co/L4hHvjgRwF

Very informative press conference just now. The coronavirus presents a unique threat to our nation which will require bipartisan cooperation throughout all levels of government. I am confident our nation can rise to the challenge. https://t.co/J8cIwUKHt1

The 3 new people in Nassau County who just tested positive for Coronavirus were all connected to the 1st patient who was confirmed yesterday. Please remember to follow this advice from the CDC: https://t.co/AvhTRGu6X4 https://t.co/8O3GNWyWpt

Coronavirus is a serious threat that is spreading fear and anxiety around the world. Instead of trying to politicize this unique situation Members of Congress must work with health officials and the Trump admin to do everything we can to understand contain & eliminate it.

China bears responsibility for the colossal mismanagement of the Coronavirus. The rest of the world is now stuck with the huge consequences of China’s massive failure. We must now work together to figure this out contain it and eradicate it.
